Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    SDK 1.8 Board acts as, you guessed it, the 'board' of the game. The Board class handles the players involved, and is the main component for playing and making sure valid board moves are made. The moves are made with two player instances and the game is checked for completion, whether it be draw or victory, after each move
    Author:
    Marc Shepherd

      private Player player1

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        Board(Player playerType1,
      Player playerType2)
        Board constructor takes in two arguments that are used to downcast the initialized Player object into the specified subclass
        Parameters:
        playerType1 - -- the type of player, player1 cast either to HumanPlayer or ComputerPlayer
        playerType2 - -- the type of player, player2 cast either to HumanPlayer or ComputerPlayer

    • Method Detail

      • playTTToe

        public void playTTToe()
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.InterruptedException
        The overarching method is responsible for running the entire game, where players makeMove() and logical checking is done. Checks for draws or a player winning is also made.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - //Logical exception handling, needed as methods used within this method throw may them
        java.lang.InterruptedException - //Exception handling, needed as methods (computer player) used within this method may throw them

      • isEndGame

        private boolean isEndGame(java.lang.String[][] board)
        Checks for end-game -- checks each indice in the board and returns true only if victory/draw detected -- used within playTTToe() method
        Parameters:
        board - -- board array brought in to check
        Returns:
        -- false if not end-game, true if end-game

      • isDraw

        private boolean isDraw()
        Private helper function for isEndGame() function to reduce clutter
        Returns:
        false if still going / not won, true otherwise

      • isHuman

        private boolean isHuman(Player player)
        Helper function for part of game to check if human or computer
        Parameters:
        player - takes in player instance to check sub
        Returns:
        true if human, false if computer (or anything else)
